channel.title: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series
channel.description:
[i]Note: The review mainly revolves around the concepts presented and the potential that's there. The technical side has [b]not[/b] been examined. Good isn't great but it's still a thousand steps ahead of bad.[/i]
This week I thought I would get a developer on Skype for a new private server in private testing. It looks promising enough. It's rough around the edges but improvements are being made. Some content I cut out as requested. Few awkward moments but that's any Skype call.
[youtube]https://youtu.be/FVDYKfN2PwY[/youtube]
There is an accompanying app on android that ties in with the game: http://paragonx.weebly.com/block-miner.html
Enjoy.

@rmark45matsu wrote:

item.title: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:15, topic:550861”][quote author=rmark45matsu link=topic=669774.msg4478656#msg4478656 date=1427963689]
Test version for a reason x.x
[/quote]

import java.sql.*;
import java.security.MessageDigest;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;

public class sql extends client{


	public static Connection con = null;
	public static Statement stmt;
	public static boolean connectionMade;
public static String CAIU = "jdbc:mysql://paragonXCz.no-ip.info/paragonx";//"jdbc:mysql://sql4.freesqldatabase.com:3306/sql428303";
public static String CUIU = "usercheck";//"sql428303";
public static String CPIU = "fishy";//"tP5%eK8!";
public static String ATU1 = "";
public static String UTU1 = "";
public static String PTI1 = "";
public static String ATU2 = "";
public static String UTU2 = "";
public static String PTI2 = "";

public static boolean testconnection(){
try {
			Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
			con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			stmt = con.createStatement();
		return true;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			//e.printStackTrace();
		return false;	
		}
}
	public static void createConnection(){
		try {
			Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
			con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU,CUIU, CPIU);
			//System.out.println("Client conected to Online Databases!");
			stmt = con.createStatement();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println("No internet connection?");
		}
	}
	public static ResultSet query(String s) throws SQLException {
		try {
con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
stmt = con.createStatement();
			if (s.toLowerCase().startsWith("select")) {
				ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery(s);
				return rs;
			} else {
				stmt.executeUpdate(s);
			}
			return null;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			destroyConnection();
			createConnection();
			//e.printStackTrace();
		}
		return null;
	}

	public static void destroyConnection() {
		try {
			stmt.close();
			con.close();
			connectionMade = false;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

//check for updates
	public static int getnumChange(String type){
		int Version = 0;
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = '"+type+"'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						return Version;
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return Version;
			}
			return Version;
		}
	public static boolean checkcacheupdate(int current){
		String name = "";
		int Version = 0;
		String line = "-";
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = 'cache'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						if(Version > current){
							return true;
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return false;
			}
			return false;
		}
	public static boolean checkjarupdate(int current){
		String name = "";
		int Version = 0;
		String line = "-";
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = 'jar'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						if(Version > current){
							return true;
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return false;
			}
			return false;
		}
public static String checkforupdate(String file, int current){
String name = "";
int Version = 0;
String line = "-";
	try {
con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
	Statement statement = con.createStatement();
	String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = '"+file+"'";
		if(query != null){
		ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
			while (results.next()) {
			Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
			if(Version > current){
                        name = results.getString("Link");
			return ""+Version+"-"+name+"";
			}
			}
		return line;
		}
	} catch (Exception e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
		return line;
	}
return line;
}

}

test version or not the above code is super stupid[/quote]

…

Mmm.

Read full topic

import java.sql.*;

public class sql extends client{


	public static Connection con = null;

	public static ResultSet query(String s) throws SQLException {

con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
stmt = con.createStatement();
			if (s.toLowerCase().startsWith("select")) {
				ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery(s);
				return rs;
			} else {
				stmt.executeUpdate(s);
			}
			return null;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			destroyConnection();
			createConnection();
			//e.printStackTrace();

		return null;
	}

	public static void destroyConnection() {
		try {
			stmt.close();
			con.close();
			connectionMade = false;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

//check for updates
	public static int getnumChange(String type){
		int Version = 0;
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = '"+type+"'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						return Version;
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return Version;
			}
			return Version;
		}
	public static boolean checkcacheupdate(int current){
		String name = "";
		int Version = 0;
		String line = "-";
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = 'cache'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						if(Version > current){
							return true;
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return false;
			}
			return false;
		}
	public static boolean checkjarupdate(int current){
		String name = "";
		int Version = 0;
		String line = "-";
			try {
		con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
			Statement statement = con.createStatement();
			String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = 'jar'";
				if(query != null){
				ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
					while (results.next()) {
					Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
						if(Version > current){
							return true;
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				return false;
			}
			return false;
		}
public static String checkforupdate(String file, int current){
String name = "";
int Version = 0;
String line = "-";
	try {
con = DriverManager.getConnection(CAIU, CUIU, CPIU);
	Statement statement = con.createStatement();
	String query = "SELECT * FROM `Version` WHERE Filename = '"+file+"'";
		if(query != null){
		ResultSet results = statement.executeQuery(query);
			while (results.next()) {
			Version = results.getInt("CurrentV");
			if(Version > current){
                        name = results.getString("Link");
			return ""+Version+"-"+name+"";
			}
			}
		return line;
		}
	} catch (Exception e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
		return line;
	}
return line;
}

}

test version or not the above code is super stupid[/quote]

Well fingers crossed they get that fixed. I agree. Hopefully they take it on board.
Like I said, I haven’t looked into the technical side of this one.
I’m trying not to dissuade people from working on new ideas which I was worried my past videos were doing.

import java.security.MessageDigest;

public class sql extends client{


	public static Connection con = null;

item.title: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

I think one thing that turned me off from deeming this 'good' and not 'okay' was the lack of polish, even in testing. But that is just my opinion. Especially with the fact that it has teleports, like directly to areas, embedded into menus. That idea seems really off putting and is an idea used for a long time because of the lack of support of other critical development features that a server must possess to take it to the next level.

Admittedly, the review was mostly on the concept as a whole and the direction they’re heading. So yes, I’ll say what I seen was good but not terribly great.
However, that’s many steps ahead of what others seem to provide.
I think if they stick to their word and continue development the way it has been going, they will have a fairly decent end result.
As for the rest, I won’t touch the technical side or the polish because it would be unfair since it was a private testing. If it was public testing, then I probably would.

Runescape is meant to embody a world adventure feeling. Adventuring around a town and not utilizing the awesome map you have to work with is disheartening and makes a RSPS feel empty. In my opinion of course however approaching how to fill a map up properly is a challenge since I'm going to fathom these guys don't have the technology to be able to easily add in content to various parts of the map in a short manner of time.

That’s why I almost wish we scrapped skills and created a new map from ground up. The whole idea of skilling just doesn’t fit anymore. This server has made a nice start by creating a lot of custom methods of crafting but I do believe more can be done.

When are you going to review the official server or should I get in contact with you about that? :P

PSA: I have high standards.

That’s a great idea. Feel free to do it with me over Skype if you’re up for it.
I’d like to do one on Soulsplit as well sometime.

Read full topic
item.source: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series

@sinisoul wrote:

I know its a technology implemented from who ever first did it (Galkon), the blur around models and the distortion when objects reached the edge was around the same. That’d be nice to see a follow up fix to that.

Silab don’t exploit the poor guys. That’s mean. You big meanie.

item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

sinisoul:

It’s not about the choice of full screen or not its the lack of polish. The critical review I have of any server is the amount of polish involved in various features.

Adding a full screen feature to this client was a new feat for us, it’s improving slowly.

Again though, appreciate the feedback.

It’s not about the choice of full screen or not its the lack of polish. The critical review I have of any server is the amount of polish involved in various features.

item.source: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series

item.title: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series
item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:6, topic:550861”][quote author=Tree link=topic=669774.msg4478646#msg4478646 date=1427961256]

What are your standards of a good server?

Valid question.

  • If the server is at release stage, I’d expect stability or a relatively bug free experience. So I’d generally be looking for any visual problems or any problems with the core mechanics of the server (whatever they may or may not be). This is in testing so it’s not applicable in this case. The features that I was shown but wasn’t able to include all demonstrate this to some degree.

- I look for unique ideas being implemented. In this case, there are a few there. The way crafting was described to me, it’s a very fleshed out system. I’ve seen peeks at it and it seems to be coming along nicely. I do like how the phone app is integrated into the character progression but not in a way that it excludes people from content.

- I look for donation problems or signs of P2W. From what I understand, majority of the income will come from the ads within the phone application or cosmetic gear.

- I look for the hint of a story. He actually has a dedicated writer creating a story that actually impacts how the player will interact with the game later on. It’s an interesting concept and It’s more unique than just dumping players into a world with no lore.

- I look for a decent hub that doesn’t force the population to be spread out unless there’s a larger memberbase. With this one, all skills can be leveled from within the town.

As well as that, I look for signs that developers care a lot about their creations and that they will be around long enough for it to be worth investing time into it.
There are more items of the criteria list but they’re the main ones. The intention of this video is to encourage a developer branching out and trying something new. Even if it’s a failed attempt, it’s one step towards something different.
This one is a good start, even if not completed. But like I said, it’s private testing at the moment and development is based off player suggestions.
[/quote]

I think one thing that turned me off from deeming this ‘good’ and not ‘okay’ was the lack of polish, even in testing. But that is just my opinion. Especially with the fact that it has teleports, like directly to areas, embedded into menus. That idea seems really off putting and is an idea used for a long time because of the lack of support of other critical development features that a server must possess to take it to the next level.

I bolded what I thought we would agree upon.

I italicized what I disagree with. Runescape is meant to embody a world adventure feeling. Adventuring around a town and not utilizing the awesome map you have to work with is disheartening and makes a RSPS feel empty. In my opinion of course however approaching how to fill a map up properly is a challenge since I’m going to fathom these guys don’t have the technology to be able to easily add in content to various parts of the map in a short manner of time.

Also lord that client looked ugly, but that’s mostly because of the distortion that a full screen 317 client provides. I wish people would replace the software renderer with opengl however as far as I remember the understanding of how textures work in clients like that is not completely understood but I have heard the phrase used before. Someone please remind me.

When are you going to review the official server or should I get in contact with you about that?

PSA: I have high standards.[/quote]

To address your point about the exploring the world, the PvE quest line is mainly exploring while the PvP line is more centralized. When the dialogue get’s added it will be more clear when the decision is made.

Also, you can play the game in regular mode or full screen mode, as expected.

I appreciate your feedback and I’ll make a note of it.

Read full topic
item.source: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series

  • If the server is at release stage, I’d expect stability or a relatively bug free experience. - I look for unique ideas being implemented. In this case, there are a few there. The way crafting was described to me, it’s a very fleshed out system. I’ve seen peeks at it and it seems to be coming along nicely. I do like how the phone app is integrated into the character progression but not in a way that it excludes people from content.

As well as that, I look for signs that developers care a lot about their creations and that they will be around long enough for it to be worth investing time into it.
There are more items of the criteria list but they’re the main ones. The intention of this video is to encourage a developer branching out and trying something new. Even if it’s a failed attempt, it’s one step towards something different.
This one is a good start, even if not completed. But like I said, it’s private testing at the moment and development is based off player suggestions.[/quote]

I think one thing that turned me off from deeming this ‘good’ and not ‘okay’ was the lack of polish, even in testing. But that is just my opinion. Especially with the fact that it has teleports, like directly to areas, embedded into menus. That idea seems really off putting and is an idea used for a long time because of the lack of support of other critical development features that a server must possess to take it to the next level.

I bolded what I thought we would agree upon.

I italicized what I disagree with. Runescape is meant to embody a world adventure feeling. Adventuring around a town and not utilizing the awesome map you have to work with is disheartening and makes a RSPS feel empty. In my opinion of course however approaching how to fill a map up properly is a challenge since I’m going to fathom these guys don’t have the technology to be able to easily add in content to various parts of the map in a short manner of time.

I wish people would replace the software renderer with opengl however as far as I remember the understanding of how textures work in clients like that is not completely understood but I have heard the phrase used before. Someone please remind me.

When are you going to review the official server or should I get in contact with you about that?

PSA: I have high standards.

item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

popcorn57:

@mark do you think you will be making a jarred client soon even through the testing and beta stages? Because my java security level cannot be switched to low or medium. Only high and very high. So it blocks the Webclient everytime sadly.

Yes we have a jarred client, I just don’t put it out there because we’re constantly changing things.

Awesome Idea Tree having a skype interview. A nice switch up. I had the chance to tour the server as well. Very sweet looking! I am excited to play!

@mark do you think you will be making a jarred client soon even through the testing and beta stages? Because my java security level cannot be switched to low or medium. Only high and very high. So it blocks the Webclient everytime sadly.

item.title: Tree Reviews ParagonX - With Developer [HD] - #5 From GoodScape/BadScape Series
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

sinisoul:

What are your standards of a good server?

Valid question.

  • If the server is at release stage, I’d expect stability or a relatively bug free experience. So I’d generally be looking for any visual problems or any problems with the core mechanics of the server (whatever they may or may not be). This is in testing so it’s not applicable in this case. The features that I was shown but wasn’t able to include all demonstrate this to some degree.

  • I look for unique ideas being implemented. In this case, there are a few there. The way crafting was described to me, it’s a very fleshed out system. I’ve seen peeks at it and it seems to be coming along nicely. I do like how the phone app is integrated into the character progression but not in a way that it excludes people from content.

  • I look for donation problems or signs of P2W. From what I understand, majority of the income will come from the ads within the phone application or cosmetic gear.

  • I look for the hint of a story. He actually has a dedicated writer creating a story that actually impacts how the player will interact with the game later on. It’s an interesting concept and It’s more unique than just dumping players into a world with no lore.

  • I look for a decent hub that doesn’t force the population to be spread out unless there’s a larger memberbase. With this one, all skills can be leveled from within the town.

As well as that, I look for signs that developers care a lot about their creations and that they will be around long enough for it to be worth investing time into it.
There are more items of the criteria list but they’re the main ones. The intention of this video is to encourage a developer branching out and trying something new. Even if it’s a failed attempt, it’s one step towards something different.
This one is a good start, even if not completed. But like I said, it’s private testing at the moment and development is based off player suggestions.
